import React, { useState } from 'react'; import "./productLIst.css" const products = [ { id: 1, category: 'all', img: 'img1.jpg' }, { id: 2, category: 'clothing', img: 'img2.jpg' }, { id: 3, category: 'electronics', img: 'img3.jpg' }, { id: 4, category: 'clothing', img: 'img4.jpg' }, { id: 5, category: 'electronics', img: 'img5.jpg' }, { id: 6, category: 'all', img: 'img6.jpg' }, { id: 7, category: 'clothing', img: 'img7.jpg' }, { id: 8, category: 'electronics', img: 'img8.jpg' }, { id: 9, category: 'all', img: 'img9.jpg' }, { id: 10, category: 'clothing', img: 'img10.jpg' }, ]; const ProductList = () => { const [menu, setMenu] = useState('all'); // Filter the products based on the selected category const filteredProducts = menu === 'all' ? products : products.filter(product => product.category === menu); return ( <>
  • setMenu('all')}> All
  • setMenu('electronics')}> Electronics
  • setMenu('clothing')}> Clothing
  • setMenu('accessories')}> Accessories
{filteredProducts.map(product => ( ))}
); }; export default ProductList;
